Show / Hide Table of Contents

Class MoveAction

A type of BattleAction selectable from a BattleMenu. They have sequences that the BattleEntity performs.

Inheritance

SpecialCaseColor

The color used for displaying the text for MoveActions in special cases.

Examples include indicating the FP cost was lowered with Flower Saver, or Quick Change being active.

Declaration

Disabled

Whether the MoveAction is disabled in the menu or not.

This is often true if the user doesn't have enough FP to perform the move. It's also true if the move can't hit any BattleEntities it targets.

Declaration
public bool Disabled { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

| Improve this Doc View Source

GetEntitiesMoveAffects()

Gets the set of BattleEntities that this move affects.

The default behavior is to get the entities based on the MoveAction's Enumerations.MoveAffectionTypes.

Declaration
public BattleEntity[] GetEntitiesMoveAffects()
Returns
Type Description
BattleEntity[]

The BattleEntities the move affects based on its MoveAffectionType and the HeightStates it can target. If None, an empty array is returned.
| Improve this Doc View Source

InitActionCommandSequenceSettings()

Initializes settings for the action's Action Command and MoveSequence. Settings include whether they should auto-complete or not based on the action user's properties.

Declaration
protected void InitActionCommandSequenceSettings()
| Improve this Doc View Source

Initialize()

Initializes the MoveAction, checking if it should be disabled or not based on certain conditions.

Common conditions include not having enough FP to perform the move and not being able to reach any BattleEntities with this move.

Declaration
public virtual void Initialize()
| Improve this Doc View Source

OnActionEnded()

What happens when the MoveAction ends. This is called immediately after ending the Sequence.

Declaration
public virtual void OnActionEnded()
| Improve this Doc View Source

OnActionStarted()

What happens when the MoveAction starts. This is called immediately before starting the Sequence.

Declaration
public virtual void OnActionStarted()
| Improve this Doc View Source

OnMenuSelected()

What happens when the MoveAction is selected on the menu. The default behavior is to start target selection with the ActionStart method

Declaration
public virtual void OnMenuSelected()
